latest_works.title: Timap!
latest_works.blurb: Reimplementation of a prior project to investigate vibecoding methodologies.
latest_works.problem: Timat is A platform for finding, creating, and joining sports matches. The legacy project lacked a clear interaction strategy and provided no structured way to evaluate how vibecoding principles could enhance product differentiation or user engagement.
approach: Rebuilt the product end‑to‑end to create a stable foundation for experimentation
Explored multiple mood‑driven interaction models to identify opportunities for added user value
Prototyped and refined vibecoding behaviors to assess their impact on usability and product feel
Documented insights and defined actionable patterns that could inform future product directions
latest_works.outcome: Delivered an updated prototype demonstrating how vibecoding can elevate the product experience, offering concrete patterns and learnings that support strategic decision‑making for future feature development.

latest_works.title: Double Dare You
latest_works.blurb: Reimplementation of a prior project to investigate vibecoding methodologies.
latest_works.problem: Users lacked a simple, engaging way to create and participate in social challenges with clear objectives, progress tracking, and accountability features.
approach: Designed and developed a mobile app enabling users to create challenges with goals, durations, rewards, and optional proof requirements
Built participation flows allowing individuals and groups to join challenges and track daily progress
Implemented social sharing features to increase visibility and encourage community engagement
Refined the user experience through iterative prototyping and continuous testing
latest_works.outcome: Delivered a fully functional iPhone app that streamlines social challenge creation and participation, increasing user engagement through structured goals, progress tracking, and shareable achievements.

latest_works.title: AI as a UX Research Tool (Thinking Styles)
latest_works.blurb: Explored using AI to synthesize research into 'Thinking Styles' frameworks and journey maps.
latest_works.problem: Need for faster synthesis of qualitative research into actionable patterns for non-technical users.
approach: Defined a simulated problem statement for an ed‑tech product
Used AI prompts to transform research documents into Thinking Styles patterns
Created tables, journey maps, and synthesized insights from AI outputs
Validated AI-generated artifacts against researcher reviews and refined prompts
latest_works.outcome: Produced structured research artifacts and journey maps that accelerated early-stage synthesis and ideation.

ia_experiments.title: E-commerce Navigation Restructure
ia_experiments.blurb: Validated a new taxonomy with 100+ participants.
ia_experiments.problem: Users struggled to find products in existing navigation structure.
approach: Ran open card sort with 50 participants
Validated results with closed card sort
Tree testing to measure findability improvements

ia_experiments.title: Multi-tenant Product Taxonomy
ia_experiments.blurb: Designed a flexible taxonomy serving diverse user groups.
ia_experiments.problem: Platform needed to serve users with vastly different mental models.
approach: Interviewed stakeholders across segments
Created flexible faceted taxonomy
Validated with representative users
ia_experiments.outcome: Successfully launched taxonomy to multiple customer segments.

product_process.title: Design System for VR
product_process.blurb: Built the first centralized design system for a VR product to bring consistency and speed to design and development.
product_process.problem: Lack of shared design standards led to inconsistent VR interactions and fragmented dev implementations.
approach: Researched VR interaction patterns and benchmarked successful XR apps
Defined reusable UI patterns and interaction primitives for spatial interfaces
Created a Figma UI kit and documentation hub in Confluence
Collaborated with engineers to map components to Unity implementations
product_process.outcome: Established reusable VR UI patterns, improved cross-team alignment, and reduced implementation inconsistencies.

product_process.title: Onboarding Guides and Feature Documentation
product_process.blurb: Structured product documentation to improve team autonomy and knowledge sharing.
product_process.problem: New team members and cross-functional colleagues lacked clear documentation, causing onboarding friction and duplicated work.
approach: Audited existing materials and documentation gaps
Defined a scalable documentation structure and templates
Created feature guides, onboarding checklists, and audience-specific summaries
Centralized content in Confluence and promoted adoption across squads
product_process.outcome: Faster onboarding, fewer repeated questions, and a single source of truth for feature knowledge.

product_process.title: Design Elements in Unreal Engine
product_process.blurb: Recreated the Figma UI kit inside Unreal to enable consistent, reusable UI components for developers.
product_process.problem: Developers struggled to translate Figma designs into Unreal, causing layout inconsistencies and manual rebuilds.
approach: Mapped Figma atomic components (atoms, molecules, organisms) to Unreal widgets
Rebuilt common components as standardized whitebox widgets
Documented styling, spacing, and usage rules to mirror the Figma system
Validated components through developer feedback and integration tests
product_process.outcome: Reduced manual UI rebuilds, improved visual consistency, and accelerated developer implementation.

product_process.title: Rapid Prototyping Framework
product_process.blurb: Validated concepts in days instead of weeks.
product_process.problem: Lengthy design cycles delayed product validation.
approach: Built low-fi to hi-fi prototype templates
Created testing script library
Streamlined stakeholder review
product_process.outcome: Concept-to-validation time reduced from 3 weeks to 5 days.

product_management.title: Product Strategy and Roadmap Alignment
product_management.blurb: Defined a structured roadmap and communication formats to align leadership and squads.
product_management.problem: Leadership goals were not translated into actionable plans, causing misaligned priorities and fragmented efforts across teams.
approach: Audited initiatives and backlog to identify overlaps and gaps
Designed a tiered roadmap framework linking short-term deliverables to long-term bets
Introduced a cadence of three releases per year with MVPs for each cycle
Created tailored visual artifacts for different audiences
product_management.outcome: Improved cross-team alignment, clearer prioritization, and a repeatable release cadence that reduced scope drift.

product_management.title: Release Planning and Backlog Management
product_management.blurb: Organized work items and clarified ownership to accelerate delivery and reduce bug backlog.
product_management.problem: High volume of untriaged issues and unclear ownership slowed releases and increased rework.
approach: Structured feature tables with owners, effort estimates, and priorities
Implemented sprint-level tracking and release dashboards
Coached teams on writing clear user stories and acceptance criteria
Coordinated cross-functional reviews to validate scope before implementation
product_management.outcome: Reduced backlog noise, improved visibility into release scope, and increased predictability of delivery.

product_management.title: Data-Driven Roadmap Framework
product_management.blurb: Aligned design and PM on feature prioritization.
product_management.problem: Feature requests overwhelmed team without clear prioritization.
approach: Created RICE scoring framework
Integrated user research data
Facilitated quarterly planning
product_management.outcome: Shipped more high-impact features per quarter with clearer prioritization.

ux_research.title: Primary Menu Redesign
ux_research.blurb: Redesigned the primary product menu to improve clarity and visual unity.
ux_research.problem: Users struggled to understand menu icons and labels, weakening navigation and cohesion.
approach: Audited the current menu and identified friction points
Analyzed GA reports and user feedback to prioritize issues
Benchmarked comparable interfaces and best practices
Proposed a redesigned menu with clearer labels and iconography
ux_research.outcome: Delivered a redesigned menu and guidelines that improved discoverability and visual consistency.

ux_research.title: VR App Navigation Redesign
ux_research.blurb: Redesigned a VR navigation system to align with familiar interaction standards.
ux_research.problem: Existing navigation did not follow established VR interaction patterns, causing confusion during onboarding.
approach: Conducted comparative analysis against industry VR platforms
Ran moderated usability sessions and observational research
Iterated navigation concepts and validated with users in VR prototypes
Documented interaction patterns and handed off specs to engineering
ux_research.outcome: Implemented a navigation model aligned with familiar VR standards, reducing user confusion and easing onboarding.

ux_research.title: Moderated Testing Framework
ux_research.blurb: Standardized research process across the organization.
ux_research.problem: Inconsistent research methods led to unreliable insights.
approach: Created testing script templates
Trained team on facilitation
Built insight repository
ux_research.outcome: Research velocity increased with higher quality and repeatability.
